<>
"""/> \end \define create-todos() <$action-setfield $tiddler="TaskDraggableTemplate" text="""<$checkbox tag="done"> <$link to={{!!title}}><$view field="title"/>"""/> <$action-setfield $tiddler="Tasks" text="""!! Outstanding tasks <$button> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="New Task" tags="task" />New Task //Drag the tasks to re-order them// <> !! Completed tasks <$list filter="[!has[draft.of]tag[task]tag[done]sort[created]]">
<$checkbox tag="done"> ~~<$link to={{!!title}}><$view field="title"/>~~
"""/> <$action-navigate $to="Tasks"/> \end \define lingo-base() $:/language/ControlPanel/Basics/ Welcome to ~TiddlyWiki and the ~TiddlyWiki community Before you start storing important information in ~TiddlyWiki it is vital to make sure that you can reliably save changes. See https://tiddlywiki.com/#GettingStarted for details !! Set up this ~TiddlyWiki
|<$link to="$:/SiteTitle"><> |<$edit-text tiddler="$:/SiteTitle" default="" tag="input"/> | |<$link to="$:/SiteSubtitle"><> |<$edit-text tiddler="$:/SiteSubtitle" default="" tag="input"/> | |<$link to="$:/DefaultTiddlers"><> |<>
<$edit tag="textarea" tiddler="$:/DefaultTiddlers"/>
//<>// |
!! More Options !!! Show Home Button <<< <$checkbox tiddler="$:/config/PageControlButtons/Visibility/$:/core/ui/Buttons/home" checked="show" unchecked="hide" field="text"/> Check this box to show the {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/home}} Home button in the sidebar <$reveal state="$:/config/PageControlButtons/Visibility/$:/core/ui/Buttons/home" type="match" text="show"> More page buttons can be found in the right sidebar ''Tools'' tab <<< !!! Show Journal Button <<< <$checkbox tiddler="$:/config/PageControlButtons/Visibility/$:/core/ui/Buttons/new-journal" checked="show" unchecked="hide" field="text"/> Check this box to show the {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/new-journal}} Journal button in the sidebar <$reveal state="$:/config/PageControlButtons/Visibility/$:/core/ui/Buttons/new-journal" type="match" text="show"> More "Journal" and "New Tiddler" options can be found using the {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/control-panel}} $:/ControlPanel '': Info : Basics'' tab. <<< !!! Create Table of Contents <<< <$checkbox checkactions=<> tiddler="TableOfContents" tag="$:/tags/SideBar" /> Check this box, to create the "Contents" tab in the sidebar <$reveal stateTitle="TableOfContents" type="match" stateField="tags" text="$:/tags/SideBar"> The ''tag'' for the TOC is: TableOfContents. <$button><$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" tags="TableOfContents" />Create a TOC tiddler ><$checkbox tiddler="$:/config/ViewToolbarButtons/Visibility/$:/core/ui/Buttons/new-here" checked="show" unchecked="hide" field="text"/> Check this box to show the {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/new-here}} "New Here" Button in the ''tiddler toolbar''. This simplifies to create a TOC hierarchy <<< !!! Create a Basic ~ToDo List <<< <$checkbox checkactions=<> tiddler="Tasks" tag="TableOfContents" /> Create a very basic sortable ~ToDo App and add it to the TOC if available <$reveal stateTitle="Tasks" stateField="title" type="match" text="Tasks"> <$checkbox tiddler="Tasks" tag="$:/tags/SideBar" /> Add Tasks to the right sidebar More info can be found at: [[tiddlywiki.com|https://tiddlywiki.com/#list-tagged-draggable%20Macro:%5B%5Blist-tagged-draggable%20Macro%5D%5D%20%5B%5BTaskManagementExample%20(Draggable)%5D%5D]] <<< !!! Change the Story Layout >The layout and much more can be change at the Control Panel. >Open: <$button actions=<> >~ControlPanel : Appearence : Theme Tweaks to adjust the story width with the "sidebar layout" parameter " }, "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/history": { "title": "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/history", "text": "V 0.1.0 - 2020.06.07 * Initial release " }, "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/license": { "title": "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/license", "text": "[[GettingStarted EN Plugin|https://u9t.github.io/#getting-started-en]] (c) Mario Pietsch - 2020- https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause " }, "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/readme": { "title": "$:/plugins/u9t/getting-started/readme", "text": "''Important:'' This plugin includes options in the GettingStarted tiddler, which allow users some basic customisations!
